f1_2025_tracks.info: Melbourne’s fast-flowing semi-street circuit opens the 2025 season with tight corners and heavy braking zones.
China’s technical layout features a signature spiral opening and one of the longest straights in F1.
Japan’s historic figure-eight circuit challenges drivers with its high-speed rhythm and complex corners.
A desert venue with multiple overtaking zones and extreme track abrasion under floodlights.
A narrow, ultra-fast street track in Saudi Arabia with close walls and rapid-fire corners.
This American track surrounds the Hard Rock Stadium and mixes long straights with slow, tricky sectors.

f1_2025_tracks.official_name: Imola – Autodromo Enzo e Dino Ferrari
f1_2025_tracks.info: A historic Italian venue with elevation changes and fast sweeping corners in the Emilia-Romagna region.
The jewel of F1, Monaco’s unforgiving streets require surgical precision and offer zero margin for error.
A balanced Spanish circuit often used for testing, combining flowing corners with a long main straight.
Montreal’s island track provides a mix of high-speed straights and tight corners bordered by close walls.
Austria’s compact layout delivers short laps, elevation shifts, and aggressive overtaking opportunities.
The spiritual home of F1, Silverstone is all about high-speed corner sequences and raw downforce.
Belgium’s beloved Spa features elevation, high-speed turns, and unpredictable weather in the Ardennes forest.
Hungary’s tight and twisty layout favors high downforce and penalizes poor qualifying performance.
This Dutch circuit offers dramatic banking, fast corners, and an electric orange-clad fan atmosphere.
Italy’s temple of speed with minimal drag and maximum slipstreaming down long straights.
Azerbaijan’s high-speed street course blends wide boulevards and tight medieval turns around a castle.
Singapore’s humid night race offers a brutal 2-hour endurance challenge through a tight urban jungle.
Austin’s Tilke-designed circuit includes iconic elevation changes and corners modeled after Silverstone and Suzuka.
Mexico City’s thin-air circuit includes a stadium section and long straights favoring low-downforce setups.
Brazil’s chaotic classic features a flowing lap with dramatic weather shifts and passionate fans.
A neon-lit, high-speed spectacle weaving through the heart of Vegas nightlife with long straights.
Qatar’s wide and flowing circuit hosts a floodlit night race with smooth tarmac and high-speed curves.
Abu Dhabi’s season finale features sunset drama and a recently revamped layout for better racing.
